column1: Purchased thisheadphone on 6th August and was delivered on 8th August. Have been using it since 2 days.My findings are it has a decent sound quality with medium bass. Battery lasts for 12-15 hours as mentioned.. Dual pairing works perfectly.Call quality is ok. Though I found the receiver may hear the voice little low. Bluetooth range is not more than 6-7 metres.The main problem is with the battery indicator. The battery indicator drops to 80%
column3: to 20% directly and then to 0. It doesn't decrease in serial order from 100
column5: 98 and so on. Those who have checked my review and have bought the headphone can please check the same if they also have this issue with their headphone.. I may need to replace it if I am the only one having this issue. Thank you.Read more

column1: It was a steal deal during prime days. This wireless earphone is equipped with all up to date technologies and features.1. Sound quality:Both bass and balanced EQ modes are nicely optimized. Bass mode produce deep and punchy bass without any distortion even at higher volume (unlike other models) and still it retains the clarity of mids and highs. Balanced mode is also well optimized with balanced mids and highs.My rating: 4.8/52. Battery life: Using for last three days (2-3 hours each day on average) and still 70% battery left. Charged for just 10 minutes. And bang! It's fully charged!My rating: 5/5 (Really impressed but I've to check long time performance)3. Connectivity:Bluetooth 5.0 is super fast. Only drawback is that there is no auto on/off or even play/pause by magnetic detachment of earphones (magnetic attachment is no no use in this earphones).My rating: 4/54. Build quality: Smooth and silicon material at the neck band (it's super flexible
column2: see photo attached) with matte finish
column3: plastic body feels like high quality. Wires could have been better. Earpieces have metal and matte finished plastic materials with super soft buds for comfort. Hooks are there to provide firm grip so that earbuds never fall while running/jogging.My rating: 4.2/5Read more

column1: I'll get straight to the pros and cons of Boat Rockerz 255 Pro Bluetooth earphones.PROS:1. Sound- compared to the non-pro version
column2: it seems to me that there's slight improvement in quality. Not that it is very noticeable
column3: but a slight improvement.Bass- has got good quality and quantity of bass compared to others in the same price range. The bass is clean
column4: tight and is not muddy like realme bluetooth earphones.Vocals- the vocals are clear and crisp.Loudness- it is loud enough to be heard in a noisy environment.2. Comfort- the earphones are comfortable to wear but without the ear guides. Maybe that's just me
column5: but wearing along with the ear guides gave me pain in the ears which eased off once the ear guides were removed.3. Design- it is of neckband design that is comfortable to wear. The buds have got magnets in it which helps it stick to one another when hanged down so that no tangling occurs.4. Colour- comes in some trendy colours like yellow
column7: blue and red. The youngsters would love this just for that.5. Fast charging- gets completely charged in just an hour and has got high voltage protection too.6. Sound isolation- nothing to brag about but comparable with others in the same price segment.7.Mic- the calls were very clear. The person at the other end told me that the voice was audible without any disturbances and indeed very clear.8. Connectivity- this has got the A2DP feature. So dual connectivity is present and I did not experience any connection drops of any kind.9. No Lag- there was no lag experienced while playing PUBG.CONS:1. Battery- this is the biggest gripe anyone could have with this earphone. The battery gets emptied quickly compared with its peers. Though there's fast charging one would expect headphones in this price range to last at least 10 to 12 hours but not Rockers PRO lasts for almost 6 to 8 hours. That's what I got out of them and that was not enough.2. Price- the asking price of 1599rs is high. You may get it for 1200rs during offers. Even then it is not value for money because of the poor battery backup.3. No auto on-off with magnetic buds- the feature which is present in Realme bluetooth earphones. This feature could have improved the battery life of this pair very much but alas it doesn't have it.Final words:Boat Rockerz 255 Pro bluetooth earphones are good in terms of sound quality and trendiness but lack in terms of battery backup. Though there are several pros than cons it all comes down to the battery life and this one loses out on that badly.Other options in the same price range - LoodAudio Everloop (good @1169rs)
